subject: Re: [junit] Eclipse console not displaying system.out when running from JUnit.
msgSnippet: Marvin, Just to be clear, you do see a Console view for the JUnit process, but no output is displayed in the Console?  Java Stack Trace Console is a red
messageBody:
Marvin,

Just to be clear, you do see a Console view for the JUnit process, but
no output is displayed in the Console? "Java Stack Trace Console" is a
red herring: that's a scratch space for pasting stack traces from bug
reports and other outside sources so you can easily navigate to stack
frames, and should never automatically display any output.

David Saff

Marvin Toll wrote:

> This is a bit embarrassing.
>
> For over a year I've used Eclipse. All of the sudden system.out
> statements (and stack traces) within the code are not appearing in
> the
> console when "running as" or "debugging as" a JUnit test.
>
> To my knowledge no console (preference) settings have changed.
> Currently using:
> Version: 3.1.0
> Build id: I20050627-1435
>
> (Did verify defaults "Show when program writes to standard out"
> and "Show when program writes to standard error" both remain checked.
>
> Also confirmed "Java Stack Trace Console" - not CVS.)
>
> Any leads?
>
> _Marvin
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
